channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Arlington National Cemetery’s Section 60 is a focus of controversy. What is the area?
item.description: Many U.S. servicemembers from Afghanistan and Iraq wars are interred in this solemn place. It made news after a cemetery official tried to prevent former President Trump’s campaign from taking photos.
item.content:encoded:
Many U.S. servicemembers from Afghanistan and Iraq wars are interred in this solemn place. It made news after a cemetery official tried to prevent former President Trump’s campaign from taking photos.

(Image credit: Kent Nishimura/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: 'Very demure, very mindful' trademark issue is 'handled,' TikTok influencer says
item.description: While Jools Lebron was captivating millions of people with her "very demure, very mindful" TikTok videos, at least two people submitted applications to trademark her catchphrases.
item.content:encoded: While Jools Lebron was captivating millions of people with her "very demure, very mindful" TikTok videos, at least two people submitted applications to trademark her catchphrases.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Understanding Israel's Raids And Settler Expansion in the West Bank
item.description:
On Wednesday Israel launched raids into the Occupied West Bank, they say to root out Hamas militants and prevent another attack like the one that occurred on October 7th. We hear the latest on those raids.

And Israelis who believe the West Bank should be Israeli territory have significantly increased settlement activity since the war in Gaza started. Our correspondent visits some of the outposts.
item.content:encoded:
On Wednesday Israel launched raids into the Occupied West Bank, they say to root out Hamas militants and prevent another attack like the one that occurred on October 7th. We hear the latest on those raids.

And Israelis who believe the West Bank should be Israeli territory have significantly increased settlement activity since the war in Gaza started. Our correspondent visits some of the outposts.

(Image credit: Nasser Ishtayeh)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Trump shooter saw rally as 'target of opportunity,' FBI says
item.description: The FBI says the gunman who targeted former President Donald Trump at a rally in Butler, Pa., in mid-July viewed it as a "target of opportunity."
item.content:encoded:
The FBI says the gunman who targeted former President Donald Trump at a rally in Butler, Pa., in mid-July viewed it as a "target of opportunity."

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Supreme Court rebuffs Biden administration plea to restore SAVE student debt plan
item.description: The justices rejected an administration request to put most of the latest multibillion-dollar plan back into effect while lawsuits make their way through lower courts.
item.content:encoded:
The justices rejected an administration request to put most of the latest multibillion-dollar plan back into effect while lawsuits make their way through lower courts.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Former elected official found guilty of murdering Las Vegas veteran reporter
item.description: An elected official in Las Vegas blamed his 2022 primary defeat on negative stories in the local newspaper. Now a jury has found him guilty of murdering the journalist who wrote them.
item.content:encoded:
An elected official in Las Vegas blamed his 2022 primary defeat on negative stories in the local newspaper. Now a jury has found him guilty of murdering the journalist who wrote them.

(Image credit: K.M. Cannon)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: FAA grounds SpaceX ahead of historic Polaris Dawn commercial spacewalk
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration opened the investigation after a rocket booster toppled aboard a drone ship after it was returning from lofting SpaceX's Starlink internet satellites into space.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Aviation Administration opened the investigation after a rocket booster toppled aboard a drone ship after it was returning from lofting SpaceX's Starlink internet satellites into space.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: 2 men are charged with toppling ancient rock formations at Lake Mead trail
item.description: A federal grand jury has indicted two men in connection with the April incident at the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. The charges carry a maximum penalty of 10 years in prison.
item.content:encoded:
A federal grand jury has indicted two men in connection with the April incident at the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. The charges carry a maximum penalty of 10 years in prison.

(Image credit: Screenshot by National Park Service)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Harris is on a 2-day Georgia bus tour. It’s the latest sign the state is in play
item.description: Vice President Harris and running mate Tim Walz just kicked off on a two-day bus tour in Georgia. The state President Biden narrowly won in 2020 is again in play.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris and running mate Tim Walz just kicked off on a two-day bus tour in Georgia. The state President Biden narrowly won in 2020 is again in play.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: 'Swifties for Kamala' think Harris is the 1 to beat Trump. And they want to help
item.description: By the end of their call Tuesday, 14,000 attendees reported registering to vote.
item.content:encoded:
By the end of their call Tuesday, 14,000 attendees reported registering to vote.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore
